In Julia, Write a function `timezone_bumper(dt,bump)` that increases any provided timestamp by `bump::Int` hours (defaults to +3 hours). Make sure it works only for DateTime types and throws an error for Date types.

Here is the solution in Julia:

```julia
using Dates

function timezone_bumper(dt::DateTime; bump::Int=3)
    if typeof(dt) == Date
        throw(ArgumentError("Date type not allowed, only DateTime types are accepted"))
    else
        return dt + Hour(bump)
    end
end
```
This function will increase the provided timestamp by `bump` hours. If a date is passed instead of a datetime, it will throw an error.
